# `split chars` for [strings](/commands/categories/strings.md)

<div class='command-title'>Split a string into a list of characters.</div>

## Signature

```> split chars {flags} ```

## Flags

 -  `--grapheme-clusters, -g`: split on grapheme clusters
 -  `--code-points, -c`: split on code points (default; splits combined characters)


## Input/output types:

| input        | output             |
| ------------ | ------------------ |
| list\<string\> | list\<list\<string\>\> |
| string       | list\<string\>       |
## Examples

Split the string into a list of characters
```nu
> 'hello' | split chars
â•­â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â•®
â”‚ 0 â”‚ h â”‚
â”‚ 1 â”‚ e â”‚
â”‚ 2 â”‚ l â”‚
â”‚ 3 â”‚ l â”‚
â”‚ 4 â”‚ o â”‚
â•°â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â•¯

```

Split on grapheme clusters
```nu
> 'ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡µã»ã’' | split chars --grapheme-clusters
â•­â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â•®
â”‚ 0 â”‚ ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡µ â”‚
â”‚ 1 â”‚ ã» â”‚
â”‚ 2 â”‚ ã’ â”‚
â•°â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â•¯

```

Split multiple strings into lists of characters
```nu
> ['hello', 'world'] | split chars
â•­â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â•®
â”‚ 0 â”‚ â•­â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â•® â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 0 â”‚ h â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 1 â”‚ e â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 2 â”‚ l â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 3 â”‚ l â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 4 â”‚ o â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â•°â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â•¯ â”‚
â”‚ 1 â”‚ â•­â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â•® â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 0 â”‚ w â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 1 â”‚ o â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 2 â”‚ r â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 3 â”‚ l â”‚ â”‚
â”‚   â”‚ â”‚ 4 â”‚ d â”‚ â”‚
```
